  • Constructor Details

    • ChessBoard

      public ChessBoard()
      constructor for the chess game. Initializes the board with the default size of 8, sets the first player as white, calls initializeBoard() to set all the pieces to the board
      See Also:
      • initializeBoard()

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      Creates a 2D array and fills it with all the pieces in the correct positions

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck(PieceColor color)
      Checks if the King of the given piece color is in check.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess piece
      Returns:
      returns if there is no possible move that can save the king

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate(PieceColor color)
      Checks if the King of the given piece color is in checkmate
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess piece
      Returns:
      returns true if there is piece of the opposite color that can capture the king. False otherwise

    • findKing

      public King findKing(PieceColor color)
      finds the king of the given chess piece color on the board
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess piece
      Returns:
      returns the king piece (object) by searching through the normal board based on the color

    • getPieces

      public List<ChessPiece> getPieces(PieceColor color)
      gets all the pieces of the given color on th board.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess piece
      Returns:
      returns all the pieces of a color that are still alive on the board as List of ChessPieces

    • getBoardCopy

      public ChessPiece[][] getBoardCopy()
      Gets a copy of the chessboard
      Returns:
      Returns a copy of the current board's game state as a 2D array

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck(PieceColor color, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Determines if the given piece has a check
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess piece
      board - the current state of the board
      Returns:
      returns true if the board has a check for the color passed through, false otherwise

    • findKing

      public ChessPiece findKing(PieceColor color, ChessPiece[][] board)
      finds the king of the given chess piece color on the board
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the chess piece
      board - the current state of the board
      Returns:
      Returns the king piece by searching through the passed in board based on the color

    • isAttacked

      public boolean isAttacked(int kingRow, int toCol)
      This method checks to see if a square is being attacked. It is used in conjunction with the movePiece() method. This is primarily used to check if the king's pathway will be attacked during castling.
      Parameters:
      kingRow - the row that the King piece is in as an int
      toCol - the column that needs to be checked with respect to the king row
      Returns:
      returns true if an opponent piece can attack a square. returns false if no piece can attack the square

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol)
      movePiece()
      Parameters:
      fromRow - the row the chess piece originates from
      fromCol - the column the chess piece originates from
      toRow - the desired row to move the chess piece to
      toCol - the desired column to move the chess piece to
      Returns:
      Returns true if the move indicated by the player can actually be done and moves the piece if possible. False otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string of the chess board with all the pieces in their respective spots.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Returns the string of the chess board with all the pieces in their respective spots.

    • setDrawOffered

      public void setDrawOffered(boolean offered, PieceColor color)
      Sets the indicator that the opponent wants to draw
      Parameters:
      offered - This should be set to true as a draw is offered.
      color - The color of the player that wants to draw

    • isDrawOffered

      public boolean isDrawOffered(PieceColor color)
      Gets the status of if a draw has been offered. This is used so that the opponent of the player who has requested to draw has to draw and therefore end the game.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player that needs to be checked for the draw
      Returns:
      Returns if draw is mutually agreed upon

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer()
      Gets and sets the turn to the next player. Used when a valid move or offer is executed.

    • promotePiece

      public void promotePiece(int endRow, int endCol, String[] tokens)
      Checks if piece being moved is a pawn and is at one of the ends of the board, if so the piece is promoted to Q automatically unless specified by the user
      Parameters:
      endRow - the end row that the pawn should be at in order to be promoted
      endCol - the end col that the pawn should be at in order to be promoted
      tokens -
